activity.text: @YourBroCode npm install @rollup/rollup-darwin-arm64

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_teleicu_devices_fe#22
activity.text:
When you make updates locally, make sure to run npm run build to see the changes, 
You should run npm run build after each change to see the updates

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_teleicu_devices_fe#22
activity.text:
1. Fork the care_teleicu_devices_fe repo, then clone it to your local machine.
2. Inside the cloned repo, run npm install.
3. Then run npm run build.
4. After that, run npm run preview.
5. The project will be running on port 10120.
6. Add the following to your care_fe repo‚Äôs environment variables:
7. REACT_ENABLED_APPS="{your-username}/care_teleicu_devices_fe@localhost:10120"
8. Then run care_fe using:
9. npm run dev

if you face any ui issue add   important: true,  in tailwind.config.js on care_fe repo
make sure to run the two repo simultaneously

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11436
activity.text: @abhimanyurajeesh @rithviknishad  does we have another method to enable autofillü§î

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11436
activity.text:
OTPCredential API - Supported Browsers & Devices
The OTPCredential API is currently supported on the following browsers and devices:

‚úÖ Supported Browsers:
Google Chrome (Version 93+)
Microsoft Edge (Version 93+)
Samsung Internet (Version 17.0+)
‚úÖ Supported Devices:
Android (With Chrome or Edge)
Some Samsung Devices (With Samsung Internet)
‚ùå Not Supported On:
iOS & iPadOS (Safari does not support the OTPCredential API)
Firefox
Desktop Browsers (Even on Chrome & Edge, OTP autofill is mobile-only)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11259
activity.text:
> Hey [@modamaan](https://github.com/modamaan),
> 
> I don't know, but there is some code syncronization error in my repo. Sorry about that
> 
> Production website has insurance cliams tab in encounter section but in my local repo, though I synched forked repo from original Care_Fe till latest commit but still now showing this options and manually tried to go there but shows page not found error
> 
> Here is the problem video: [bug video drive link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sDcIhBQWPF2ar425pNvyBrSoW1SRy-Q4/view?usp=drive_link)
> 
> Solution of issue :
> 
> The
> 
> that renders Payer Id can be assigned tailwind class 'break-words' which wrap the overflow text inside container
> 
> Here is developer tool based demo solution of it : [solution video demo link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CDvD_FUNNQzMVnJqxA_sVElyEV9nSFNa/view?usp=drive_link)

@Jacobjeevan

@ohcnetwork/care-fe-code-reviewers

## Merge Checklist

- [ ] Add specs that demonstrate bug / test a new feature.
- [ ] Update [product documentation](https://docs.ohc.network).
- [ ] Ensure that UI text is kept in I18n files.
- [ ] Prep screenshot or demo video for changelog entry, and attach it to issue.
- [ ] Request for Peer Reviews
- [ ] Completion of QA
